alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 3:43AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Crawford, southwestern Washington, northeastern Haskell, Sequoyah, Adair, southeastern Cherokee and northeastern Muskogee Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 343 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Proctor to 2 miles east of Cherokee Landing State Park to Greenleaf State Park to 2 miles southwest of Keefeton. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tahlequah... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Lincoln... Warner... Vian... Gore... Webbers Falls... Marble City... Braggs... Tamaha... Adair State Park... Brushy... Christie... Greenleaf State Park... Pumpkin Center... Maryetta... Cookson... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 278 and 313. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
